results.title: Palaeolithic man
results.brief_description: Illustrates the way of life of palaeolithic hunters and food gatherers, based on three sources of evidence that remain today - weapons and implements found near their primitive hearths, drawings from European cave settlements and the nomadic lives of Australian Aborigines.

results.title: Palace Cafe
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Murray Fahey and Andrew Lancaster
results.brief_description: The Palace Cafe, a place where solitary drinkers sip their cappuccinos, read their newspapers and nothing much else happens. The cafe becomes alive one night when a lonely man spots an attractive woman across the room and staff and patrons burst into dance, choreographing their moves to the tune of the lonely man’s imagination.

results.title: Pal Joey
results.creator_credit: Essex, George Sidney Productions, Fred Kohlmar and George Sidney
results.brief_description: Pal Joey, starring Frank Sinatra, Kim Novak and Rita Hayworth, is strong, funny entertainment based on a novel by John O’Hara. It features 14 songs from Rodgers and Hart including “The Lady is a Tramp”, “Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered” and “My Funny Valentine”. Sinatra is an out of heel nightclub singer, Joey Evans, who plays the field with women. He is ideal as the irreverent, glib Joey.

results.title: Pakistan: a two-part nation
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Suzanne Talbot Isaacs
results.brief_description: A study of East and West Pakistan, this film views the problems which arise from differences in people, geography and economy, between the two. Amidst uncertainty that threatens progress, the two Pakistans are held together by their religious tie of Islam.
results.description: A study of East and West Pakistan, this film views the problems which arise from differences in people, geography and economy, between the two. Amidst uncertainty that threatens progress, the two Pakistans are held together by their religious tie of Islam.

results.title: Pak Menggung: a Javanese aristocrat
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, John Morris, Keith Gow and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours. Indonesia”.
Java is no longer ruled by kings and queens. The aristocrats who remain live in their palaces, but they are mostly poor. When they die so will many of their traditions. This passing history is recorded by following the daily life of Pak Menggung, writer and collector of ancient Keris. This film gives insight into the courtly traditions of art, etiquette and ceremony of Java. Photography is by famous Australian cinematographer, Don McAlpine.

results.title: Paisa
results.creator_credit: Organizzazione Film Internazionali, Foreign Film Productions and Roberto Rossellini
results.brief_description: Spoken in Italian dialogue with English subtitles. Covering the period from the Allied landings in Sicily in 1943 to the Liberation in 1945, Paisa is a film in six episodes. Each deals with a different aspect of the war in Italy; from the personal, (a drunken G.I. visits a prostitute and fails to recognise her as the young girl with whom he’d fallen in love only months earlier), to the field of battle itself, (brutal partisan warfare in Florence and the marshlands of the Po Delta). Following on from “Rome, Open City”, this was Rossellini’s second great neo-realist work and is one of the peak’s of film history. Stars Carmela Sazio, Robert Ban Loon, Dots M. Johnson, Maria Michi, Gar Moore, Harriet White, Renzo Avanzo, Bill Tubbs, Dale Edmonds.

results.title: Pairing off
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Six of the best”.
Introduces issues concerned with living away from home, multicultural differences and male and female relationships. Carl and Theresa move in together and their Italian parents cannot accept this. Paula goes out with Gary who has a cynical approach to business and personal relationships.
